job_description:
Join Our Team. Grow with Us.
BI SOLUTION ENGINEER - CUSTOMER SUCCESS
About Us

Dundas Data Visualization is a global leader in the development of advanced data visualization, dashboard and business intelligence solutions. Our outstanding success is reflected in our numerous industry awards and in the rapid adoption of Dundas technologies by Fortune 500 companies around the world. Discover the opportunity to join a dynamic company that fosters the development of its people.
What’s in it for you?
A collaborative and creative environment where experimentation, learning and stepping beyond your comfort zone is not only encouraged, but rewarded
Complete autonomy – micro-management is not in our vocabulary
A healthy work-life balance and desirable benefits including an onsite gym membership, free parking, full dental coverage, flexible working hours and professional improvement perks (think conferences and classes, etc.)
Learn and grow with the best in the business -> become the best in the business. We provide the support you need to achieve success in your career
A culture that values diversity, authenticity, inclusivity and above all else, fulfilment
We thrive on the uniqueness and individual talents of our teams and want to work with people who aren’t afraid to let their personalities shine! If you’re enthusiastic, ambitious, a little bit weird, and passionate about the future of Business Intelligence, then we want to read your resume! Submit your application and we’ll take it a look at it right away. Thanks so much for expressing an interest in joining us on this journey.

About the Job
As a BI Solution Engineer, Customer Success, you will work with Clients and Dundas teams, to drive productivity and help our customers grow their business. We are looking for a highly energetic individual with a technical background and business/sales smarts to make Dundas customers successful with our product.

This position will give you the opportunity to work with customers around the globe and across all industries. You will get the chance to learn not only diverse technical skills but also about business intelligence, business analysis, project management, and will give you the possibility to learn how companies work as well as measure their performance.

In this role, you will be the bridge and key coordinator between Dundas and Client, developing and maintaining long-term relationships by engaging customers and providing excellent consultative support. You will be responsible for understanding requirements and challenges faced by our customers which hinders their BI system/product from going live to market. You will be advising customers during their development using our product, services and/or solutions. You will be driving growth within existing customer base by promoting and delivering user engagement activities such as forums responses, lunch and learns and much more

About You
Degree (or college certificate) in information technology combined with business courses or any other related field or must have 2+ years practical experience
Ideally have 2+ years of customer facing experience working with external clients in a position such as business systems analyst, consultant, sales engineer, or pre-sales solutions architect in the software industry
Practical experience with any other reporting tools or any other BI tools such as Reporting Services, Crystal Reports, Excel, etc.
2+ year experience with databases and SQL scripting
Familiar with any programing languages such as C#, JavaScript, HTML
Familiar with cloud technologies
Your Soft Skills:
You enjoy interacting with people and have great listening skills
Very strong communication, interpersonal and comprehension skills, both verbal and written
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
Strong problem solving/troubleshooting skills
Willing to learn new skills on a regular basis, both on and off the job
Able to work well within a team, yet be able to work autonomously
Able to work in a company with an open and casual work environment


Apply Now
Please send your resume via email to careers@dundas.com and reference “BI Solution Engineer” in the subject line. If you have any questions about this position or our company, please feel free to ask we will be more than glad to ensure you have the information you need.

We are expanding our Software Development team with two more business intelligence engineers to accelerate insights and analytics development here at Altus. As part of the Program Insights team, you’ll be a core contributor to our Analytics product, helping grow and scale our data warehouse and dashboard system designed for our customers in higher education.
As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you’ll collaborate with product managers and product designers to come up with ways to visualize business intelligence questions like “Is my student failing?” and “Compare how my course is doing year over year”. You’ll design, architect and roll out Qlik-based solutions, working directly with other developers and customers on engineering impactful data visualizations and discovering meaningful data trends. You’ll leverage your deep knowledge of Qlik and best practices for building performant, scalable apps. You’ll tackle permission issues, establish best practices for variables, formulas, and load, and discover areas where we can improve our processes to make future Qlik development more manageable, better and faster.
In addition to Qlik, you’ll work across tools and technologies like Git, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Python, JavaScript, ReactJS and CSS.
The work you do will contribute to our greater mission of creating a world filled with more people-centred, empathetic doctors, nurses, teachers and other professionals.
This is a full-time position based in Canada and reports to our Development Manager for the Program Insights, Scott Hsieh. We are a remote-first company. To accommodate employees that want or need an office or prefer a hybrid option, we returned to a limited office presence in Toronto in January 2022. We provide co-working space opportunities for employees outside the GTA.
Collaborative work typically takes place between 9 am PST - 2 pm PST / 12 pm EST - 5 pm EST, with most team members working either within the PST or EST time zones.
In this role, you will:
Develop, maintain, enhance and support Qlik Sense applications.
Provide expertise in Qlik Sense programming and ensure application design adheres to the overall architecture blueprint.
Make recommendations on best practices, managing/storing data, setting up roles, section access, site setup and creating dashboards.
Conduct in-depth analysis with interpretive thinking to define issues and develop innovative solutions with Qlik Sense and data warehouse.
Write complex Qlik Set Analysis formulae within apps and data load-scripts.
Gather requirements from stakeholders and end-users to review, analyze and translate into technical specifications.
To thrive in the role, you:
Have worked with Qlik for 3 years or more, and have some professional experience in a programming or data analytics-focused role.
Have expertise in data modelling and optimized data modelling for Qlik visualizations and Qlik set analysis and formulas.
Proficiently can work with Qlik permission and section access, extensions.
Have professional experience with data cleaning, data analysis and visualization techniques.
Are experienced with Qlik mashups and managing Qlik application deployments.
Have a “Qlik Sense Data Architect” or “Qlik Sense System Administrator” Certification.
Have a knack for spotting mistakes in data and choosing data that best represents larger datasets.
Understand UI/UX best practices.
Are comfortable utilizing a version control system, such as Git or Bitbucket.
To thrive at Altus, you are:
Able to live our core values of Caring, Curious, Driven while cultivating a positive and professional attitude.
Someone who prefers working in an entrepreneurial environment where you get to be a builder, doer, and optimizer, work autonomously, challenge the status quo and help us focus where it counts.
A person with loosely held yet strong opinions. You know why you want what you want and remain humble, accept that you can be wrong, and constantly seek to create better solutions.
Highly curious about how our business works and genuinely interested in the Higher Education and Education Technology industry.
Driven by our mission to create a world served by exceptional professionals.
The interview process
We designed our process to give you a positive experience and follow equitable assessment practices. We've outlined the general steps you can expect to go through below.
Intro Conversation. An actual human from our People & Culture team will review your application. If selected, you’ll be able to share your story and experiences and learn more about the role, team, and company in more detail. (Time allocation: 30 - 45 minutes)
Meet The Manager. You'll meet your potential future manager via a video call to discuss your background and experiences in more depth. (Time allocation: 30 - 60 minutes)
Meet The Team. You'll meet with 2-4 members of our team over a video call. They will assess your technical skills, values alignment, and how you might contribute to our culture. Before this interview, you may complete an assignment that closely mirrors some aspects of the role and present your work to the team. (Time allocation: up to 3 hours)
Reference Checks. We'll ask you for 2-3 professional references we can reach out to and chat about your time working together.
Wait For a Final Decision. While you wait, the Hiring Manager consolidates and evaluates feedback from each team member who was part of your interview process. We may reach out to you for a quick additional conversation to reach a decision.
Receive an Offer. If you are our match and we believe you feel the same way, we'll extend an offer and go over the details with you on a video call. (Time allocation: 20 minutes)
We offer you
A Competitive Salary. We've designed our total rewards strategy to compensate you above the Canadian-based tech market rate.
Flexible, Self-Directed Vacation. Take time off when you need it. We recommend one week per quarter in addition to federal and provincial statutory holidays and company-wide paid time off, but there are no firm rules. We trust you.
Company-wide Paid Time Off. We turn off our work on Altus Days (a bonus Friday off every month) and the last two weeks in December (for the Holiday Season).
GRSP Matching Program. If you choose to participate in our Group Registered Savings Plan program through Wealthsimple, we match your contribution up to 2% of your salary each pay period, pre-tax income.
Stock Option Plan. To benefit from the growth you contribute to and the opportunity for future ownership in the company, we grant you options that start vesting on your first day of employment.
Learning & Development Budget. We've allocated an annual budget of $3,000 you can use towards your professional and personal growth.
Access to Health Coverage from Day 1. You can enroll in our comprehensive health, dental, vision, and life benefits plan through Equitable Life of Canada on the day you join us.
Parental Leave With Top-Up. Growing your family is an exciting time, and we support and encourage you to take time off with your new loved ones. 4 months of your parental leave topped up to 80% of your salary. You can extend your parental leave with top-up payments for four months if you choose.
Sick Time, Other Leave. Take paid time off when you're experiencing illness, a medical or family emergency, the loss of a loved one, or need to nurture your wellness.
Choose Where You Work. Work from home, our office space in downtown Toronto, in a coworking space, or take your work on the road for a little while. If you live outside of the GTA and want to rent a coworking desk, we've got you covered for up to $150 per month.
Home Office Workspace Equipment. You'll receive a Mac laptop or equivalent of your choice, and we'll support you with other workspace accommodations you need for your home office.
Transparency. Through our weekly All Hands and monthly financial updates, you'll have visibility into business metrics, progress, performance and overall company health.
A little about us
At Altus, we've built a HigherEd Program Intelligence Platform that supports higher education programs and students from application to graduation. Armed with data from admissions, student assessment and program operations, schools can identify and train diverse, exceptional and people-centred professionals.
We're a quirky, vibrant, and diverse group of 140+ working together remotely across Canada to tackle challenging problems (like evaluating empathy in someone who wants to train to become a doctor) and some less tough ones (like how to answer that bonus question on Trivia Night).
Our core values are Caring, Curious, and Driven, and we embody these in everything we do. We genuinely care about the well-being of others, we possess an innate desire to learn continually, and every day we strive to be better than the person we were the day before.
We believe diverse and inclusive teams bring more perspective to the table, build better products, drive greater financial outcomes and create a better workplace. That is why we focus on being an equitable company and emphasize a culture of belonging for everyone, regardless of your race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, and veteran or disability status.
Thank you for considering Altus as your next career stop!

Join us in helping people live healthier, happier & longer lives


PlushCare, an Accolade company (NASDQ: ACCD), is a Silicon Valley-based virtual primary care platform that is transforming the healthcare industry by making exceptional healthcare more accessible, convenient, and affordable. Since 2015, we've connected hundreds of thousands of patients throughout the United States with world-class physicians from a phone or laptop.

As we continue to grow and expand our services, we are looking for passionate and empathetic individuals to be part of our journey. Experience in the startup ecosystem is helpful, but a growth mindset and passion for helping people live healthier, happier & longer lives is essential.

The Role: Senior Analytics Engineer

PlushCare is looking for an experienced analytics engineer with a strong background in data modeling and an understanding of business concepts to help us build and improve our data warehouse. In this role, you will work closely with our business partners, analysts and engineering to build ETL pipelines and design data structures that will shed light on the patient experience and improve our ability to make decisions using data.

Responsibilities

Architect, create and maintain data pipelines from data extraction through to final analytical data structures
Work closely with data analysts and business stakeholders to define data requirements for analytics initiatives
Learn the business context for data; design performant data models that enable downstream reporting and analyses
Support engineering in designing for analytics consumption
Collaborate within the analytics team to improve our infrastructure and maintain reliability, accuracy and efficiency

Experience and Qualifications:

Flexible and adaptable. Comfortable becoming the team expert in technologies and business domains required to solve the problems at hand.
5 years of experience in data management disciplines including data integration, modeling, optimization, and data quality.
Understanding of system internals and performance trade offs of distributed OLAP databases.
Expert in MySQL (5.7) and Redshift SQL languages.
Familiarity with SCD1, SCD2, and Change Data Capture techniques for scalability.
Comfortable working in Python performing transformations of JSON and CSV datasets.
Experience with Apache Airflow is a big plus.
Experience with Tableau is a plus.

We offer:

 An opportunity to elevate your career
 Competitive compensation + equity in a high-growth company
 Professional development budget to support your growth
 Generous vacation policy and take care of your health days
 Medical, dental, vision
✅ 401(k) Match
Quarterly home office and weekly lunch stipends
Plus: A PlushCare membership for you and your family!


We believe diversity drives innovation. We are committed to inclusion across race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We celebrate multiple approaches and diverse points of view that drive us forward every day. #LI-DNI

PlushCare's Privacy and Data Policy

PlushCare is committed to protecting your privacy and data. Click the privacy policy link to learn more:

PlushCare's Applicant Privacy Policy

Our Statistics & Privacy team focuses on establishing step-change improvements to advance our long-term business growth. The team's expertise spans many domains including statistics, machine learning, economics, and cryptography. We develop methodologies, design and prototype solutions, and partner with our engineering colleagues to launch these solutions such that 3 billion people and 200 million businesses on our platform can benefit. Examples include internal and external experimentation platforms, ads delivery optimization for efficient causal outcomes, and the application of privacy enhancing technologies across our ads product stack.Meta seeks industry-experienced Research Scientists to join Statistics & Privacy and serve as scientific leaders for cutting-edge applied research. Such work necessitates identification and evaluation of new research opportunities, and development of scientifically rigorous systems. Research Scientists drive forward prototypes and methodologies, and build consensus with engineering stakeholders as to the scientific and strategic merit of our initiatives. This role will focus on designing and building new systems to power and measure the business impact of Meta’s financial products. This work is critical to our long-term product development, and we expect research scientists to provide both scientific expertise and creative solutions to accelerate their project area.-Notre équipe Statistiques et Vie Privée se concentre sur la mise en place d'améliorations radicales pour favoriser la croissance de nos activités à long terme. L'expertise de l'équipe couvre de nombreux domaines, notamment les statistiques, l'apprentissage automatique, l'économie et la cryptographie. Nous développons des méthodologies, concevons et prototypons des solutions, et nous nous associons à nos collègues ingénieurs pour lancer ces solutions afin que les 3 milliards de personnes et les 200 millions d'entreprises qui utilisent notre plateforme puissent en bénéficier. Nous pouvons citer en exemple les plateformes internes et externes d’expérimentation, l’optimisation de la mise en œuvre d’annonces pour des résultats causaux efficaces et l’application de technologies d’amélioration de la confidentialité sur nos produits de publicité.Meta recherche des chercheurs scientifiques expérimentés pour rejoindre Statistiques et confidentialité et servir de leaders scientifiques pour des recherches appliquées de pointe. Ce travail nécessite l'identification et l'évaluation de nouvelles opportunités de recherche, ainsi que le développement de systèmes scientifiquement rigoureux. Les chercheurs scientifiques font avancer les prototypes et les méthodologies, et établissent un consensus avec les parties prenantes de l'ingénierie quant à la valeur scientifique et stratégique de nos initiatives. Ce rôle se concentrera sur la conception et la construction de nouveaux systèmes pour alimenter et mesurer l'impact commercial des produits financiers de Meta. Ce travail est essentiel pour le développement de nos produits à long terme, et nous attendons des chercheurs/chercheuses qu'ils/qu'elles fournissent à la fois une expertise scientifique et des solutions créatives pour accélérer leur domaine de projet.


Research Scientist, Statistics & Privacy (Economics & Financial Engineering) | Chercheur scientifique, Statistiques et confidentialité (économie et ingénierie financière) Responsibilities:

Identify specific, high-impact opportunities to build new and improve existing financial services solutions | Identifier des opportunités spécifiques et à fort impact pour créer de nouvelles solutions de services financiers et améliorer les solutions existantes
Design and prototype new algorithms, optimization methods, and system architectures with a focus on panel modeling and forecasting, financial engineering, and observational causal inference | Concevoir et prototyper de nouveaux algorithmes, des méthodes d'optimisation et des architectures de système en mettant l'accent sur la modélisation et la prévision de panels, l'ingénierie financière et l'inférence causale observationnelle
Build cross-functional relationships to shape long-term roadmaps with a balance of scientific rigor and strategic considerations | Établir des relations interfonctionnelles afin de façonner des feuilles de route à long terme avec un équilibre entre la rigueur scientifique et les considérations stratégiques
Learn new tools, systems and languages quickly as required by the particular project you are working on | Apprendre de nouveaux outils, systèmes et langues aussi rapidement que l'exige le projet.


Minimum Qualifications:

PhD in a quantitative field such as economics, statistics, finance, operations research, or computational social science, or MS/MA degree with 4+ additional years of relevant experience | Doctorat dans un domaine quantitatif tel que l'économie, les statistiques, la finance, la recherche opérationnelle ou les sciences sociales computationnelles, ou diplôme MS/MA avec plus de quatre années supplémentaires d'expérience pertinente
Expertise in financial statistics/engineering or causal inference (including addressing challenges from incomplete, unrepresentative, and mislabeled data) | Expertise en matière de statistiques/ingénierie financière ou d'inférence causale (y compris la résolution des problèmes liés aux données incomplètes, non représentatives et mal étiquetées)
Proficiency designing and implementing analytical and/or algorithmic solutions, tailored to particular business needs and tested on large data sets | Compétences en matière de conception et de mise en œuvre de solutions analytiques et/ou algorithmiques, adaptées à des besoins commerciaux particuliers et testées sur de grands ensembles de données
Proficiency in communicating analyses and establishing confidence among audiences who do not share your disciplinary background or training | Compétences en matière de communication d'analyses et de mise en confiance de publics qui ne partagent pas votre formation ou vos antécédents disciplinaires
Expertise in Python or R | Expertise en Python ou R


Preferred Qualifications:

Track record of product or systems innovation, and strategic focus | Antécédents en matière d'innovation de produits ou de systèmes, et orientation stratégique.
Experience with building data-driven systems for risk modeling, pricing, forecasting, or observational causal inference at scale | Expérience de la création de systèmes axés sur les données pour la modélisation des risques, la tarification, les prévisions ou l'inférence causale observationnelle à l'échelle
job_title: Research Scientist, Statistics & Privacy (Economics & Financial Engineering) | Chercheur scientifique, Statistiques et confidentialité (économie et ingénierie financière)

job_description:
WHY JOIN THE TEAM?

To have the opportunity to be at the center of a major transformation of BRP’s system and to participate in every step of a large‑scale project

To have the opportunity to leave your mark on BRP by implementing SAP EWM as the warehouse management system for all the distribution centers of finished products in North America

To work closely with different multidisciplinary teams to deliver key projects, which will enable you to master the manufacturing industry’s logistics best practices

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Business Process Analyst - EWM, you will be a key player in a transformation project with the goal of implementing SAP EWM in finished goods distribution centers in North America. You will:

Become an expert in warehouse management processes for finished products in North America

Build a network of contacts across BRP’s operations and teams of multidisciplinary partners

Gain an understanding of BRP’s vision to ensure the alignment of physical and system processes and develop optimal EWM solution

Act as the main representative for local sites and provide system requirements in workshops (SAP S/4 EWM, Analytics, warehouse layout, etc.)

Provide input for decision making on new processes to support the company vision and be responsive to the needs of local teams

Leverage your knowledge of the future EWM system to act as an agent of change in interactions with users

Liaise between Operations and the project team

Define the EWM system’s master data and participate in tests

Participate in the development of training materials and in drafting a plan for smooth deployment

Support users and the project team in system deployment

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering, logistics, business technology and systems management (information systems management [ISM]) or a related field

A minimum of 5 years of relevant and substantial experience (supply chain management, manufacturing operations, systems and technology implementation, continuous improvement)

Spoken and written English at an advanced level

Knowledge of a Warehouse Management System

Knowledge of SAP S4 EWM – an asset

Experience in project management

Experience in logistics warehouse layouts and implementation

YOUR SKILLS

Excellent ability to work in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams

Proficiency at synthesizing and communicating complex information to a variety of audiences

Strong analytical and problem‑solving abilities

Innovative and curious mind with an attention to detail

Proven leadership and interpersonal skills

Sense of initiative and excellence, autonomy, structure and rigour

Propensity for project‑based work and strategic development and implementation

Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver them turnkey

Willingness to travel on occasion

You will be working from Valcourt (Qc) and/or Sherbrooke (Qc)

WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of over 14,500 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours.

AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA! >

Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Multiple Locations, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto; Burlington; Kitchener; London; Ottawa; Vaughan; Windsor

Our Purpose
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Have many careers in one Firm.

Would you like to further develop your career with our exponentially expanding Financial Advisory Service, Modelling and Value Advisory group? Are you up for the challenge to help the most sophisticated Canadian and International clients to solve their quantitative and modelling issues?
What will your typical day look like?
In this role you will help financial services industry (FSI) clients face quantitative issues with informed confidence. Using your deep technical skills and leveraging our global network of experts, you’ll provide professional advice to our FSI clients in a wide range of situations. The result? Our clients will be better placed to take control and receive the best solutions to their complex challenges.

Develop/validate/review AML/ATF models (e.g. Transaction Monitoring, Client Risk Rating, and Sanction Screening models) based on regulatory guidelines and industry best practices.

You will also be able to learn and work in other quantitative and analytical areas including customer behavior modeling, scenario modelling, capital optimization problems, and new innovations such as cloud computing, machine learning and artificial intelligence.
About the team
Deloitte’s Financial Advisory practice delivers highly specialized advisory solutions for companies facing critical business events where significant value is at stake, in every phase of the economic cycle.
Our work is often high profile, high impact, and highly rewarding. If you’re looking for a challenge and an opportunity to grow your career alongside the best and brightest in the industry, you’ll find it in Financial Advisory at Deloitte. Broaden your skills. Broaden your reach. Broaden your career. It’s all possible at Deloitte.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you
Ideally, you are someone with:
Minimum 1/2 years of relevant experience spent within a model development or model validation team at a major financial institution; AML/ATF model related development and validation experience are a plus
Solid academic background with a master’s degree in Statistics, Financial Engineering, Quantitative/Mathematical Finance, Financial Economics, Financial Risk Management, or other relevant post graduate degree
Solid knowledge and hands-on experience in classification model development/validation using both traditional techniques as well as AI/machine learning techniques
Solid knowledge and hands-on experience in developing/validating predictive models, risk rating methodology; Knowledge in developing/validating text parsing and matching algorithms is a plus
Strong programming skills in Python, R, SQL, SAS, VBA, etc. with hands-on experience working with large and complex data are critical to success; Automation experience with any of these programming languages is a plus
Self-starter, fast-learner, and highly motivated individual who can excel under fast-paced environment and meet stringent deadlines; Strong communication skills are critical
Knowledge/experience of supervisory/regulatory requirements and guidelines including OSFI E-23, FINTRAC guidelines on AML/ATF, and PCMLTFA. Knowledge of industry best practices for AML/ATF such as Wolfsberg Principles is a plus
Canadian travel required and occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments


Our shared values
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.


The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now!
At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

job_description:
Job Requisition Id: 152446
Business Function: Engineering
Primary City: Saint John
Other Location(s):
Province: New Brunswick
Employment Type: Full-Time
Employment Status: Permanent
Language Requirement: English Essential
Employee Class and Level: UPCET02
Number of Vacancies: 1
Job Closing Date (MM/DD/YYYY):
Health and safety is our highest priority. With vaccination shown to be the most effective tool to reduce the risk of transmission of COVID-19 and protecting individuals from severe consequences of this virus, Canada Post has implemented a Vaccination Practice. Accordingly, you will be required to attest to being fully vaccinated. If you are unable to be vaccinated, you may request an accommodation due to a medical, religious, or other prohibited ground of discrimination as described in the Canadian Human Rights Act.
Job Description
The Analyst Process Engineer applies professional and technical engineering expertise in the delivery of value stream improvements, operational performance (cost, quality, time) and resource optimization (equipment, people, money) initiatives. Leads or partners in the analysis, development and deployment of regional and local projects and/or is accountable for specified deliverables in national and cross-functional projects. Ensures the correct application of engineering principles to continuous improvement projects, and that solutions are designed in accordance with the Engineering Design Process. Guides the technical work of first level process engineering team members.
Job Responsibilities
Below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the Analyst, Process Engineering:
Provides broad experience and sound technical, business and problem analysis to improve operational performance of value streams and shared business processes. Demonstrates expertise, innovative thinking and initiative in the analysis, planning and deployment of projects approved by Operations regionally or nationally.
Provides work methods design expertise to value stream improvement teams at the process or task level to promote efficiency, productivity and safety; evaluates flow constraints within the value stream to increase productivity, or reduce cost and lead time.
Supports and/or leads project teams within the Region. Provides regional and local engineering expertise in national engineering projects and deploys national projects regionally and locally. Applies professional project management skills ensuring that all approved projects are delivered on-time and on-budget; tracks and reports regularly to senior management and project sponsors on project status and benefits. Integrates change management into all project plans, ensuring that all stakeholder needs are identified, that proper communication occurs and that operational staff is educated or trained in new methods or process requirements.
Applies thorough knowledge and experience with the principles of Lean, Six Sigma and Process Management as the foundation of the Engineering Design Process, in problem solving and continuous improvement activities and documents solutions in accordance with these principles. Applies Project Management methods and tools within the Engineering Design Process to all assigned projects. Continues to develop professional and technical knowledge and skills and promotes continuous improvement.
Develops Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for all business processes and value streams and ensures that SOPs are documented in accordance with national configuration control standards.
Job Responsibilities (continued)
Oversees the collection of data required for various projects and conducts studies or analyses using this data. Develops computer applications to expedite activities and maintains program documentation.
Uses proven simulation and project management tools in the analysis of business solutions and provides comprehensive reports and recommendations. Provides engineering expertise in the use of proper technology to assess space requirements, work methods and health and safety solutions.
Uses proven financial evaluation methods and data-based engineering analyses to properly evaluate project feasibility, risks and benefits; participates in cost reduction efforts by analyzing proposals to determine viability, operations impact and return on investment.
Analyzes and recommends changes to the work environment to improve employee comfort and performance (lighting, noise, cleanliness); recommends changes to the form, fit or function of tools and equipment used by employees at their workstations to make the work easier from a human factors perspective.
Consults, informs and works with local or regional union representatives as guided by regional Labour Relations to ensure open and transparent communication on projects that are approved for implementation. Represents the project team or engineering group in meetings with various stakeholders.
Qualifications
Education
A University Degree in Engineering
Designation and or certifications:
Must be eligible for registration as a Professional Engineer in the province of employment
Experience
2-5 years of related work experience is required.
Other Candidate Requirements
Thorough knowledge of Lean, Six Sigma and Process Management.
Above average skills with Microsoft suite of tools such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint,
Working knowledge of query languages such as MS Access and SQL Server.
Familiarity with working in a union environment.
Ability to influence others and negotiate successfully, communicate ideas and generate consensus.
Excellent professional presentation and verbal communication skills.
Skilled at identifying customer needs and designing business processes and solutions to meet customer requirements.
Demonstrates innovative thinking and initiative in the analysis, planning and development of projects.
Other Information
Knowledge
Proven ability to apply Lean thinking to both operational and management value streams
Proven ability to develop Process management systems
Quality methods and basic statistics including variation (Six Sigma tools)
Measurement system design (outcome and process metrics)
Standardization of processes include definition of roles and responsibilities
Basic ergonomics of work and work design
Intermediate Project management and project planning
Systems/process design
Data analysis methods and model building
Database development
Business engineering economics and evaluation of returns on investment
Testing and sampling methodologies
Process and value stream mapping
Skills and Abilities:
Professional presentation and oral communication skills
Process design for capability
Analyze data
Work methods measurement
Prepare cost/ benefit analysis
Develop databases, queries, macros and analysis tools
Test developed designs
Identify technology solutions to meet customer needs
Write technical and business documents
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical personnel
Manage time and resources to meet required deadlines
Safety Sensitive Positions
This position may be considered a Safety Sensitive position.
Employment Equity
Canada Post will represent Canada’s diversity and provide a safe and welcoming workplace that embraces and celebrates our differences.
We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.
Conflict of Interest
The Conflict of Interest Policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. Should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential Conflict of Interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated Human Resources representative.
Accommodation
Canada Post is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you are contacted by Canada Post regarding a job opportunity, please advise if you have any restrictions that need to be accommodated. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Important Message
Your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as Canada Post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Leadership Behaviours
Decision Making – A champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner, that aligns with the corporation's best interests.
Accountability – An individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds him/herself and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.
Business Orientation – A proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.
Execution – A focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.
Leading People – A compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things.
Our Values
We value diversity as an essential part of who we are as a company, how we operate and how we see our future. We believe that attracting, developing, and retaining people who reflect the diversity of Canada is essential to our success because this matters to all communities and customers we serve.
Canada Post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.
Safety – We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.
Customer – We serve Canadians with pride and passion.
Respect – We treat each other with fairness and respect.
Integrity – We act responsibly and with integrity.
Transformation – We will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.

LEARN, DEVELOP AND GROW – WITH RELIANCE

By joining Reliance as a Inventory Analyst, you become part of an organization that is committed to delivering exceptional experiences for our customers and will support you to be your best.

What will you do?

Develop forecast models in Excel to manage inventory internally and with strategic vendors, resolve supply constraints by identifying and sourcing substitute products and working with Product Management and Operations to ensure product availability
Develop and manage relationships with strategic vendors to proactively manage product forecast and supply for highly seasonal HVAC business
Projecting inventory levels and out of stock to identify areas of risk and implementing mitigation strategies
Utilize quantitative skills to analyze, validate, manipulate and manage large amounts of data, to assess a situation and ultimately present recommendations for resolution
Source new products as defined by Product Management, collaborate with internal teams and vendors to ensure supply chain is prepared in advance of launch
Calculate financial impact of vendor price changes, leverage consumption and historical factors to determine annual spend impact to be used in negotiations with suppliers
Generate and publish vendor scorecards monthly, measuring critical supply chain KPI’s
Develop and publish various Supply Chain reports
Assess existing process and identify continuous improvement opportunities, ensure processes and work instructions are documented
Master data management in purchasing, inventory and invoice software

What do we offer?

A generous compensation plan consisting of base and bonuses
A comprehensive benefits package and group savings plan
Ongoing leadership, training, and support
Cross-functional career opportunities
Relocation opportunities
Constant internal promotional opportunities
Individualized career progression plans

What do you bring?

Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a Supply Chain related role
Degree in Industrial Engineering or Business Analytics with focus on Supply Chain, Operations and Vendor Management, Supply Chain certifications are preferred
Fundamental understanding of Supply Chain, logistics and inventory management concepts are required
Superior quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, substantial attention to detail
Ability to extract data from various systems and build reporting in Excel that leverages multiple data sources and business logic/rules
End to end process thinker, with advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint, extensive experience using an ERP system is required
Ability to think outside the box and identify practical solutions
Proven communication, interpersonal and collaboration skills to work effectively with various and diverse internal and external contacts; ability to manage up and interact effectively with management
Strong team player, motivated to exceed expectations and a desire to learn, ability to work independently as required
Employment is conditional on proof of full COVID 19 vaccine status from Provincial Ministry of Health and satisfactory criminal background check

Why Reliance?

Headquartered in Toronto, Reliance is the industry leader in providing home comfort solutions to over 1.9 million customers across North America. Reliance provides reliable home heating, cooling, hot water, water purification, electrical, plumbing & Smart Home products & services.

Each day, our Team Members are dedicated and focused on delivering an outstanding customer experience, developing top talent and giving back to the communities where we live and work. Reliance is an $900 million business with over 2,400 Team Members and growing! We are proud to be recognized by Waterstone Human Capital Ltd. as Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures.

Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
W ho we are
Do you want to shape how data will change the world? Are you ready to collaborate with inquisitive and creative people to deliver a great product to customers? At Tableau, we delight in building software that transforms messy, complicated data into a simple, curated thing of beauty. Our work helps individuals and organizations unlock the full potential of their data by removing barriers to analyzing data, answering questions, forecasting the future, creating and publishing visualizations, and sharing insights.
We‘re hiring designers at multiple levels for open positions within our Tableau Design team. As a designer at Tableau, you’ll create product experiences that empower people to see and understand data. Our stellar design team offers opportunities for professional growth, mentorship, and collaboration.
Who you are:
Problem solver. You help teams translate deep technical conversations through a lens of user needs. You have the tenacity and creativity to work through ambiguity and tell the story of what’s possible. You are excellent at communicating your design recommendations to help drive strategy and create experiences that customers need and love.
Experienced. 3 or more years’ experience doing UX design, plus a strong portfolio of design work from shipped software. You have a background in HCI, Design, or a related field, know the theory behind interaction design, and are an expert at using design tools like Figma to translate ideas into working products.
Strong partner. You thrive in a collaborative environment, planning, designing, and executing as part of cross-disciplinary agile teams.
Technical. You are curious about technology and can dive into complex or unfamiliar topics. You have a demonstrated ability to work on complex workflows and to simplify without oversimplifying.
Persuasive. You have great communication and interpersonal skills. You successfully build consensus among a diverse group of partners. You know when to ask questions, which questions to ask, and how to listen with intent to learn. You communicate your ideas clearly and effectively to a variety of audiences.
Job Responsibilities
As a Senior UX Designer, you’ll be responsible for transforming complex tasks into clear, compelling, and accessible designs. Some of your responsibilities will include:
Collaborating deeply with other UX disciplines, product managers and the engineering team throughout the product lifecycle to ensure your designs are addressing user and business needs, feasible to implement, and are subsequently implemented accurately
Build consensus and balance different priorities while dealing with ambiguity.
Balance tactical design work with strategic, blue sky thinking.
Advocate for simple, modern design and adherence to design conventions (e.g., responsiveness, accessibility)
Create user journeys, wireframes, detailed UX flows, and prototypes that show micro interactions and full experience. Create pixel-perfect visuals for product interfaces or demos when needed
Influence decision-making through presentations and storytelling with your team and partners.
Contribute to and shape our design team's platform style guide, tools and practices to scale our impact across the organization.
Qualifications:
Expert understanding of user-centered design methods and best practices
Exceptional communication and organizational skills
A professional portfolio demonstrating impactful design experience (Note: candidates without a portfolio will not be considered
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in HCI, Industrial Design, Graphic Design or related field
Experience with Tableau or visual analytics in general is a plus.



Accommodations

Calabrio is looking for a Technical Support Engineer for our Business Intelligence & Advanced Reporting efforts. In this role, you will serve as a mediator between Engineering and Customers and be the escalation point for customer-reported technical issues. The person in this role is responsible for making sure all customer issues are addressed in a timely and efficient matter.
What you’ll be doing
Provide technical assistance to all Calabrio customers for all products sold by Calabrio or Calabrio’s Reseller partners
Perform complete, accurate, and timely entry of information into CRM for all cases worked on
Provide general product information, configuration support, collection of relevant technical problem identification information, and filter non-technical problems from technical problems
Review manuals, release notes, and patch documentation for possible issue resolution
Verify compatibility matrixes as appropriate
Act as On-Call Support or escalation contact in a rotation during evening and weekend hours & escalate according to established procedures
Utilize remote secure access technologies such as VPN and WebEx to diagnose and resolved customer issues
Meet service level agreements set by the Support Manager or Director
Provide general product information, configuration support, collection of relevant technical problem identification information, and filter non-technical problems from technical problems
Enable debugging during isolation of problem to capture failure mode and analyze trace logs associated with failure mode
Provide status to the Calabrio management, the customer, Calabrio sales and external system providers support staff as necessary
Requirements
Associate's Degree, Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent experience
3-5 years of customer service experience
Experience with contact center technologies, such as agent desktop, IP-IVR, instant messaging, workforce management, and/or call recording, and technologies from leading IP telephony vendors such as:
Cisco
Avaya
Nortel
Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills
Able to manage difficult and stressful customer situations

Nice to Have
Ability to decipher, analyze, and troubleshoot problems in PostgreSQL Database.
Basic knowledge of Linux commands
Familiarity of Docker services and reporting tools
General understanding of Kibana and ETL Process
Benefits
Calabrio People are: Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent
What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and creative. We've built a company culture where you’ll feel motivated and truly excited to come to work. Calabrio is driven by the diversity of our talented team members who come from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. As an equal opportunity employer, we always consider and embrace ALL individuals including what makes them unique. We believe our team members should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of accomplishment.
About Calabrio:
Calabrio has joined forces with some of the best minds and most progressive concepts on enriching human interactions through our customer experience intelligence platform. For you, that means working on high-performing innovative teams that combine their incredible ideas in one incredible company.
Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Awards & Accolades:
Calabrio has 300 Global Partners, more than 2.25 million agents, and over 7,000 customers worldwide. We’ve been doing this for more than two decades and have been recognized by leading independent third parties such as Gartner, Forrester, and G2 Crowd as a leader and visionary. Thanks to the hard work and dedication of every Calabrio team member, we have been recognized by the Star Tribune Top Workplace for 8 years in a row, #20 on the 2020 Fast 50 list, named one of BC’s Top Employers for 2021 and recognized as a top 50 fast-growth company by Minneapolis/St Paul Business Journal.
Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.

job_description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Building a World-Class Technology Team at TD
We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
TD Data and Information Management covers building, developing, designing, and implementing involved with tech data management solutions. Where do we begin? These experts analyze, design, develop and support TD's info management system; lead and support bank data curation; develop data road map and info management strategies; focus on complex data integration, and drive use of our data reference model. This area doesn't work in isolation. We love data and we feel the same about integration and our assignments prove it.
There's room to grow in all of it.
Job Description
About This Role
As senior technical lead on large scale complex initiatives, provide leadership and expertise within specialized fields of data management, including analytics, business intelligence, modeling, profiling, governance etc., which may include aspects of the information management solution from an integrative perspective. Role also provides thought leadership and insights on emerging data management solutions for Bank wide or segment focused purposes.

Lead coordination efforts with other technology work teams such as, ITS, Architecture, TRMIS etc. to ensure project success

Perform or lead complex analysis in an evolving data environment and gather, analyze, document and maintain all data requirements related to the business applications, interfaces, and reporting environments in different kinds of data maps

Apply standards and best practices to ensure that the application’s data is accurate, complete, current, understandable, and accessible

Define, build and manage data dictionary / catalog for respective data platforms, systems / servers / applications

Manage and coordinate efforts of data modelers, data warehouse/data integration developers, and Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) data management process in database usage and data warehousing

Extract data from homogeneous or heterogeneous data sources and transform the data for storing in proper format or structure for querying and analysis purposes

Load data into the final target (database, operational data stores, data marts, or data warehouse)

Ensure metadata and data lineage is captured and compatible with enterprise metadata and data management tools and processes

Implement , maintain and enhance Data Governance, Data Quality and related policies, in alignment with TD's Enterprise standards and frameworks in collaboration with the Data Managers/Stewards/Owners

Oversee that requirements regarding privacy and security of data, data governance and access controls are appropriately captured

Comply with well-defined enterprise technology delivery practices and standards
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:
Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
Graduate Degree preferred.
10+ years experience.
Expert knowledge of technical environments and tools (e.g., user environment, applications, software, hardware, programming languages and operating systems), business processes/procedures at organizational level.
Expert knowledge of business processes and procedures, as well as broader organizational issues and technology.
Drive and implement Enterprise Tableau Architecture roadmap on Azure
Support the Tableau Migration to Azure
Remediate findings, security, and solution gaps and incorporate automation into operational and administrative processes and procedures
Monitor the health and performance of Tableau and troubleshoot any issues with the server environment (i.e. Log analysis, performance monitoring, capacity management)
Work with internal and external teams to configure and troubleshoot solution and third party tool and extensions issues
Participate in troubleshooting calls with end users, 3rd parties, and vendors that integrate with Tableau
Analyze requests and requirements for enhancing Tableau capabilities to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints
Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Our Business Technology team is seeking for an Associate Engineer to join the team developing Enterprise Integrations and Data Analytics solutions on our best-of-class cloud integration and data platforms. Your contributions in developing these solutions will directly impact mission-critical business processes that run our business.

To be successful at this position, you must be a self-starter with the ability to take ownership, work under pressure, and handle multiple tasks simultaneously while keeping a good sense of humor. You have good interpersonal communication skills, are team-oriented and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Key Responsibilities
Recognized as an engineering member of the scrum team who assists with entry-level tasks supporting the delivery of solutions, enhancements, services, and/or to provide operational support
Has basic knowledge level of MuleSoft and Snowflake technologies and ability to use tools/platforms within their functional/technology domain to:
o Develop/configure simple enhancements of low complexity
o Debug low severity production issues
Collaborates with senior engineers to deliver complex solutions, enhancements and/or services
Help with data analysis and testing workflows
Works on problems of low complexity where analysis of data requires evaluation of few identifiable factors
Demonstrates judgment in selecting methods, patterns, and frameworks for obtaining/designing/developing solutions
Collaboration is limited to the immediate scrum team
Experience
Bachelor’s in computer sciences, Information Management, or related fields
2+ years of hands-on development experience implementing integration solutions
Minimum 2 years of MuleSoft Platform development and design experience is a must
Minimum of 2 years of experience with persistence layers like MS-SQL, Oracle, Snowflake, etc. preferred
Knowledge of web services, APIs, microservices and related standards such as HTTP, REST, SOAP, and OAuth
Experience using MuleSoft Anypoint Platform – API Manager, Runtime Manager, Exchange, Flow Designer etc.
Good organization and problem-solving skills
Good to have experience in developing an Agile software development environment (Scrum)
Good to have experience with Jenkins and CI tools to automate dev, build, deployment and testing
Self-motivated, detail-oriented and organized
Willingness to learn and master unfamiliar technologies and/or concepts
Excellent verbal and written technical documentation skills
About Guidewire
Guidewire is the platform P&C insurers trust to engage, innovate, and grow efficiently.
Guidewire combines core, data, digital, analytics, and AI to deliver our platform as a cloud service. More than 400 insurers, including the largest and most complex in the world, run on Guidewire.
As a partner to our customers, we continually evolve to enable their success. We are proud of our unparalleled implementation track record with 1000+ successful projects, supported by the largest R&D team and partner ecosystem in the industry. Our Marketplace provides hundreds of add-ons that accelerate integration, localization, and innovation.
Guidewire Software Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. All offers are contingent upon passing a criminal history and other background checks where it's applicable to the position.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
